meanings.definition: To pack or arrange in advance.
meanings.sent1: I always prepack my bag before a trip to make sure I don't forget anything.
meanings.sent2: She prepacked her lunch the night before school to save time in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel prepacked its acorns for the winter, showing great foresight.
meanings.sent4: The student's mind was like a well-prepacked suitcase, organized and ready for any challenge.
meanings.sent5: Prepacking your belongings can help you stay organized and reduce stress during a move.

meanings.definition: The act of packing or arranging in advance.
meanings.sent1: My mom's prepacking of snacks for the road trip saved us from hunger on the way.
meanings.sent2: The prepacking of supplies for the camping trip made everything run smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The prepacking of the gift basket brought smiles to everyone's faces at the party.
meanings.sent4: The prepacking of information in his brain made him the go-to person for trivia night.
meanings.sent5: The prepacking of emergency kits is essential for being prepared in case of a natural disaster.
